body:
Comment 18: 
Ah, you're rigth. At least the existing specification allows different algos - it's the
other way than you proposal. ("If the capacity of s is big enough" vs "If the capacity
of s is not large enough" where the later is okay). But then again, the semantics are
well specified. Also, the behavior of 'append' in the article is illustrated completely
on 'func AppendByte' in 'Growing slices (the copy and append functions)'.
